news_header: Three astronauts from China's Shenzhou-18 mission have returned safely to Earth after six months in space, while preparations for future lunar missions continue.
news_text: The three astronauts from China's Shenzhou-18 space mission have returned to Earth after spending six months aboard the Tiangong space station. They safely landed in northern China and are reported to be in good health. Before their return, they transferred control of the space station to the Shenzhou-19 crew, who will conduct experiments aimed at landing astronauts on the Moon by 2030 and building a lunar base. Other news includes severe weather events, protests in India and Bangladesh, and updates on the Taliban's impact on women's rights in Afghanistan.
